items.title: Natco wins patent battle to launch generic 'Risdiplam'
items.summary: A Delhi High Court ruling favors Natco Pharma against Roche's rare disease drug. Natco can now launch generic risdiplam, used for spinal muscular atrophy, at a much lower cost. This decision makes the life-saving treatment accessible to more Indian patients. Roche's appeal was refused, removing a status quo. The judgment promotes affordable healthcare for a debilitating condition.

items.title: Festive cheer toys, textiles & footwear basking in GST shine
items.summary: Small businesses are experiencing a welcome boost, with GST rate cuts and the festive season driving demand in sectors like toys, textiles, and footwear. Industry bodies report positive initial feedback, anticipating sustained growth beyond Diwali due to increased consumer spending.  This positive shift is attributed to the revised tax structure, making goods more affordable.

items.title: Silver soars all time high of Rs 1.53 lakh: Why the white metal is breaking records and outpacing gold
items.summary: As the festive season approaches like Dhanteras and Diwali, that is a time when Indians traditionally invest in gold and silver, the demand for precious metals is witnessing a sharp rise. This seasonal buying trend often pushes prices upward in the domestic market

items.title: Max Healthcare plans over ₹5,000 crore expansion, eyes pan-India presence: MD Abhay Soi
items.summary: Max Healthcare has surpassed ₹1 lakh crore in market capitalization, becoming India's most valued healthcare company. The company plans a significant capex of over ₹5,000 crore for expansion, aiming to increase bed capacity substantially and extend its reach into tier-2 and tier-3 cities across India.

items.title: Bira 91 staff move plea for 'leadership change'
items.summary: Over 250 B9 Beverages employees have petitioned investors and the board for a leadership change, citing governance failures, delayed salaries, and deteriorating financials. Production reportedly stopped in July, and a significant debt investment from BlackRock has been withdrawn. Founder Ankur Jain acknowledged payment delays and business disruptions.

items.title: GST & coal cess changes to lower power tariffs: CERC
items.summary: The Central Electricity Regulatory Commission (CERC) has declared that changes in GST and coal compensation cess qualify as 'change in law' events. This ruling will allow for adjustments or refunds to distribution companies, impacting generation costs by an estimated 17-18 paise per unit. This prompt regulatory action is seen as progressive for ensuring cost-reflective tariffs.

items.title: Govt plans to infuse capital in SCI to boost fleet: Sarbanada Sonowal
items.summary: The Indian government is set to boost the Shipping Corporation of India. Plans include capital infusion for fleet expansion and forming joint ventures with oil and dry bulk companies. This move aims to meet the nation's growing export-import shipping needs. New medium-range product tankers will be procured.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh: Google to invest $10 billion in Visakhapatnam for Asia's largest data centre cluster
items.summary: Andhra Pradesh's government has approved Google's $10 billion hyperscale data center in Visakhapatnam, marking one of India’s largest digital infrastructure FDI deals.

items.title: Israeli PM Netanyahu hails President Trump, says he deserves Nobel Peace Prize
items.summary: This comes just weeks after President Trump addressed the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly on September 23, where he declared that within seven months of his presidency, he had achieved what many thought impossible.

items.title: TCS layoffs: Headcount falls by nearly 20,000 amid restructuring, NITES accuses IT major of downplaying number
items.summary: TCS layoffs: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) recorded a nearly 20,000 total employee count drop in the June to September quarter of the financial year 2025-26. However, the voluntary attrition rate in TCS dropped by 50 bps to 13.3%.&nbsp;

items.title: Russian region of Tatarstan positions itself as gateway for Indian business
items.summary: Tatarstan aims to boost economic ties with India, positioning itself as a gateway to the Russian market for Indian businesses. The region seeks to increase exports of its products while inviting Indian investment in sectors like IT and pharmaceuticals. India's opening of a consulate in Kazan underscores the growing bilateral cooperation and potential for expanded trade and academic exchange.

items.title: 'India has a lifetime opportunity...': Ericsson plans to manufacture all telecom gear it sells in India
items.summary: Ericsson plans to manufacture all telecom gear it sells in India, including 6G equipment, indigenously. The company aims to begin 6G trials by 2028 and is expanding local production capabilities, including food grain kiosks.

items.title: India’s trade dependence on the US up 0.6% in last 12 months: UNCTAD
items.summary: India's trade reliance on the US grew slightly. Global trade remains strong, driven by developing nations, even with US policy changes. Electronics and electric vehicles are boosting trade. While global trade is projected to hit new records, ongoing geopolitical tensions and US policy uncertainty pose risks to the outlook.

items.title: UK regulator vigilant after First Brands, Tricolor collapse
items.summary: BRITAIN-REGULATION/ (PIX):UK regulator vigilant after First Brands, Tricolor collapse

items.title: Akasa Air co-founder Neelu Khatri exits weeks after  ₹1,200 cr funding round
items.summary: The departure is the first from the founding team since the carrier's 2022 launch.

items.title: Truce likely at Tata Trusts board meeting
items.summary: Two senior union ministers, in an unusual action, reportedly intervened in the matter and had a meeting with some of the Trustees earlier this week. This is believed to have sent across a ‘strong message’ to the rival faction to ‘behave’

items.title: TCS Q2 net up 1.4 pc on wider margins; reports 20,000 drop in headcount
items.summary: TCS Q2 net up 1.4 pc on wider margins; reports 20,000 drop in headcount

items.title: PepsiCo beats Q3 earnings estimates; snack sales surge in India, Walmart's Steve Schmitt named new CFO
items.summary: PepsiCo's Q3 2025 results exceeded Wall Street expectations, with net revenue at $23.94 billion. The company appointed Steve Schmitt as CFO and noted strong global snack sales, amid plans to slash costs.

items.title: Satcom rollout to begin after Trai finalises spectrum prices: Jyotiraditya Scindia
items.summary: Satellite broadband services are coming to India soon. Companies like Starlink, Eutelsat OneWeb, and Jio-SES are ready to launch. The Union Telecom Minister stated that licenses are issued and a letter of intent is granted. The final step involves Trai finalizing spectrum prices. This will pave the way for high-speed internet beamed from space across the country.

items.title: TCS announces biggest AI pivot amid muted Q2 outing
items.summary: TCS reported $7.47 billion in revenue in the second quarter, up 0.61% sequentially but down 2.66% on a yearly basis–the first yearly decline in revenue during the second quarter.

items.title: US Weighs Action Against China-Connected Router Giant TP-Link
items.summary: The Trump administration is considering whether to take a major step toward restricting the US operations of TP-Link Systems Inc., a China-linked router-maker whose Wi-Fi equipment is popular in the American market, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: SEBI rationalises broker penalties, simplifies exchange rules
items.summary: Reforms include uniform penalty structure and common reporting system

items.title: IPO-bound Razorpay to enter four new South-East Asian markets after Malaysia, Singapore
items.summary: The move comes as the SaaS-based fintech firm gears up for a public listing in the Indian stock markets within the next 12–18 months.

items.title: Indian Tea Association urges price stability, relief for Darjeeling sector
items.summary: The Indian Tea Association is calling for government intervention to stabilize tea prices. They propose production controls and export support. The association also wants regulated tea imports with minimum prices. This comes as the tea sector faces significant financial strain. Over 80% of organized tea estates reported cash losses last year.

items.title: PepsiCo reports growth in snacks business in India in Q3
items.summary: PepsiCo's snack business saw a 2.5 percent organic revenue increase in the third quarter of 2025. India was among the markets contributing to this growth. However, the international beverage franchise segment experienced a one percent decline. The company's overall net revenue rose, but operating profit decreased. PepsiCo anticipates low-single-digit organic revenue growth for the full year.

items.title: Assets under management of NPS and APY cross Rs 16 lakh crore-mark
items.summary: India's combined pension schemes, NPS and APY, have surpassed Rs 16 lakh crore in Assets Under Management, with a subscriber base exceeding 9 crore. PFRDA is introducing initiatives like the Multiple Scheme Framework and a NPS Platform Workers Model to enhance investment choices and expand coverage, particularly for informal sector participants.

items.title: Canada’s Baytex Energy Weighs $3 Billion Exit of US Operations
items.summary: Baytex Energy Corp., a Canada-based oil and gas producer, is weighing an exit of its operations in the Eagle Ford shale of south Texas to refocus on its domestic assets, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Indias TCS beats quarterly revenue estimates, sees better growth in H2
items.summary: TCS-RESULTS:India's TCS beats quarterly revenue estimates, sees better growth in H2

items.title: Colombian Industry Braces for Gas Rationing as LNG Imports Pause
items.summary: Colombian companies are bracing for gas rationing as the nation’s sole import terminal closes for scheduled maintenance, casting a spotlight on the Andean country’s widening supply deficit.

items.title: NTPC, Gujarat join hands to explore opportunities in energy sector
items.summary: State-owned power giant NTPC Ltd has signed an initial pact with the Gujarat government to explore opportunities in both conventional and non-conventional energy sectors. The MoU, exchanged in the presence of Gujarat's Chief Minister and Union Minister for New & Renewable Energy, aims to bolster energy development in the region.

items.title: Tata Motors says commercial vehicles unit to be renamed as Tata Motors Limited
items.summary: Tata Motors is undergoing a significant restructuring. TML Commercial Vehicles Limited will become Tata Motors Limited. This change is part of a larger scheme of arrangement. The commercial vehicles business is being demerged. The passenger vehicle arm is merging into the parent company. Shareholders will receive new shares in TMLCV. The stock exchange listing will follow.

items.title: India aims to double bilateral trade with UK to $120 billion by 2030: Modi
items.summary: British prime minister Keir Starmer said that the India-UK free trade agreement will add “billions of pounds” to UK’s GDP and hundreds of billions of rupees to India’s, as well as add billions to wages.

items.title: Marathon Feels ‘Good’ About First Brands Debt Bought at 40 Cents
items.summary: Marathon Asset Management LP bought the term loan of collapsed First Brands Group at around 40 cents on the dollar and sees it as a “great company” with a bad balance sheet, Chief Executive Officer Bruce Richards said.

items.title: Tata Trusts meeting likely to focus mostly on routine items
items.summary: The meeting of the trustees is likely to be for mostly routine affairs, though they may also discuss the issue of keeping Tata Sons private, and chart out a path for providing an exit to Shapoorji Pallonji group, the sources said

items.title: Kotak MF suspends lump-sum investments in Silver ETF FoF
items.summary: Kotak MF said the move is meant to protect investors from entering at inflated prices, adding that the restriction is temporary and will be lifted once premiums normalise

items.title: India building high performance computing capacity under AI mission for equitable access
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced India's commitment to building High-Performance Computing capacity under its AI mission, providing every innovator and startup with affordable and easy access to new technologies.

items.title: India on track to become 3rd largest economy, says UK PM Keir Starmer as PM Modi hails 'new energy' in ties
items.summary: British PM Keir Starmer, during his visit to India, expressed confidence that the country would become the third largest economy by 2028. He and PM Modi pledged to enhance bilateral ties, shortly after the two countries signed trade deal in London in July.

items.title: Reliance Consumer revives Velvette, targets HUL and Dabur in personal care
items.summary: Reliance Consumer Products has re-launched legacy Tamil Nadu brand Velvette aiming to scale it as an umbrella FMCG brand amid ambitious  ₹1 trillion revenue plans.

items.title: Indian alco-bev industry gears up for double-digit festive growth on rising premiumisation demand
items.summary: This year, whisky, beer and wine makers are anticipating sales to significantly outperform 2024’s festive season, launching a range of limited-edition and seasonal products to capture heightened consumer demand

items.summary: India, UK to deepen cooperation in defence, education, critical minerals, technology, start-ups

items.title: Reserve Bank of India rejigs portfolios of deputy governors
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has reshuffled portfolios among its four deputy governors. New deputy governor Shirish Chandra Murmu takes charge of key departments. T Rabi Sankar, Swaminathan Janakiraman, and Poonam Gupta also receive new departmental responsibilities. Gupta will oversee Monetary Policy. Sankar is assigned 12 departments including IT and foreign exchange. Janakiraman will manage supervision and financial inclusion.

items.title: Bank holiday on Karwa Chauth: Are banks open or closed on October 10, 2025? Check here
items.summary: Bank holiday on Karwa Chauth: Banks in Shimla will be closed on 10 October for Karwa Chauth, while those across the country remain open. Various bank holidays are scheduled throughout October for festivals like Diwali and Kati Bihu.

items.title: Delhi HC allows Natco Pharma to launch risdiplam, rejects Roche plea
items.summary: The Delhi High Court has permitted Natco Pharma to launch its affordable generic version of risdiplam, a crucial drug for spinal muscular atrophy. This decision overturns a previous stay, allowing Natco to offer the medication at a significantly lower price than Swiss multinational Roche's imported Evrysdi. Roche expressed disappointment, emphasizing the importance of patent protection for innovation.

items.title: Saatvik Green Energy announces Rs 3,150 crore capex for Odisha facility
items.summary: Saatvik Green Energy announced a significant Rs 3,150 crore capital expenditure plan for its Odisha facility to boost solar cell and module production. This investment aims to expand capacity to 4 GW of modules and 4.8 GW of cells, supporting the company's strategy for integrated renewable energy solutions and domestic market demand.

items.title: Ericsson commits to 'Made in India' for all telecom gear
items.summary: Swedish firm Ericsson will manufacture all telecom equipment sold in India locally. This includes future 6G technology. The company currently produces 4G and 5G gear in India for domestic use and export. Ericsson is also expanding its research and development in Bengaluru. The firm is also working on innovative solutions like 5G-enabled food grain kiosks across India.

items.summary: In Q3, most of the deceleration, was linked to weather conditions in some of the large markets but September was strong

Rainfall led to dip in CIL's coal output in September: G Kishan Reddy
items.summary: Heavy rainfall in September disrupted mining operations, leading to a 3.9% year-on-year decline in production for Coal India Ltd (CIL). Despite this dip, the Coal and Mines Minister assured that there is no shortage of coal in the country. CIL's production for April-September also saw a decrease compared to the previous year.

items.title: Akasa Air co-founder Neelu Khatri resigns in senior management exit at country’s youngest airline
items.summary: Akasa Air's co-founder and Senior Vice President–International, Neelu Khatri, has resigned, a significant senior management departure for the airline. Khatri was instrumental in establishing Akasa's international business as the carrier aggressively expands its global network. Despite this exit, the airline stated its international expansion ambitions remain unchanged.

items.title: Monu Ratra to join Capri Global Capital as CEO after exit from IIFL Home Finance
items.summary: Monu Ratra, formerly of IIFL Home Finance, is stepping into the role of CEO at Capri Global Capital.  He will spearhead the non-bank lender's operations and growth strategy, reporting to MD Rajesh Sharma. Capri Global, a retail-focused NBFC with substantial assets under management, offers diverse loans including MSME, gold, construction finance, and housing finance.

items.title: CaratLane opens new MG Road store, Bengaluru growth hits 38%
items.summary: Looking ahead, CaratLane plans to expand further into tier-2 and tier-3 towns, introduce locally inspired designs, and invest in technology to enhance the customer experience both online and offline

UK celebrates 6,900 new jobs from Indian cross-sector investments
items.summary: Britain welcomes 64 Indian investment projects totaling 1.3 billion pounds. These deals, announced during PM Keir Starmer's Mumbai visit, will create 6,900 new jobs across the UK. Investments span electric vehicles, semiconductors, agri-tech, and AI. The UK-India trade deal is already boosting investor confidence and unlocking growth. This collaboration marks a new era for bilateral economic partnership.

items.summary: Founder and CEO Pravin Jadhav says the company plans to build new revenue streams as about 80% of its current income comes from stock broking, which has seen a sharp drop in trading volumes after recent regulatory changes

items.title: Karnataka introduces 12-day annual menstrual leave for women in public and private sectors
items.summary: Applicable to both public and private sectors, including state departments, IT companies, MNCs, and garment factories, women will be entitled to one day of paid leave each month.

items.title: Textile PLI: Govt eases investment & turnover criteria, new co norms
items.summary: The government has revised the Production Linked Incentive scheme for manmade apparel, fabrics, and technical textiles. Minimum investment and incremental turnover requirements are now lower. New companies are not mandatory for setting up units. The scheme application portal remains open until December 31, 2025. These changes aim to boost investment and growth in the sector.

items.summary: Bharat Petroleum Corporation will invest nearly eleven billion dollars to build a new refinery in Andhra Pradesh. The state government has allocated six thousand acres for this significant project. Commercial operations are expected to begin by January 2029. This development aims to boost investment and ease financial strains in the region.

items.summary: Naveen Jindal-owned Jindal Power Ltd (JPL) has agreed to acquire the 1,350 MW Jhajjar Power Project in Haryana from Apraava Energy for an estimated Rs 4,000 crore. This strategic acquisition significantly boosts JPL's thermal power portfolio, reinforcing its base-load capacity amidst robust demand.

items.title: Institutional deliveries rose to 89% due to efforts of ASHA, frontline health workers: J P Nadda
items.summary: India's healthcare sector has seen remarkable progress. Institutional deliveries have surged to 89 percent, a significant jump from 79 percent. This achievement is credited to dedicated ASHA workers and frontline health personnel. Maternal and infant mortality rates have also seen substantial declines. The government's commitment to accessible and quality healthcare is evident in these positive health indicators.

Other leagues are exploring leaner approaches and long-term investment.

items.title: Govt notifies major amendments to PLI scheme for textiles
items.summary: The Textile Ministry has revised its Production Linked Incentive Scheme for textiles. Key changes include expanding eligible products, halving minimum investment requirements, and reducing the incremental turnover criteria. These amendments aim to lower entry barriers and encourage more companies to invest. The application portal is now open until December 31, 2025, to foster wider industry participation and growth.

items.title: Aspect Realty looks to hand over 600 SRA flats in Worli by January next year
items.summary: Aspect Realty anticipates handing over over 600 slum rehabilitation flats in Worli by January 2026. The developer revived the 17-year-stalled Rs 450-crore project, clearing dues and restarting construction.  Each 300 sq ft unit will be fully equipped, offering families ownership and security after years of delay.  CEO Kedar Chapekar highlighted the team's dedication in fast-tracking quality construction.

items.title: Vande Bharat trains fail trial operations on Sabarmati–Gurgaon corridor
items.summary: Two special Vande Bharat trains from Sabarmati to Gurgaon faced disruptions. The trains could not follow their planned routes on October 5 and 6. This happened because the trains' pantographs were not compatible with the higher overhead equipment on the route. Passengers experienced significant delays. Railway officials cited poor planning for the inconvenience.

items.title: Crisil inks 15-year lease for office in Mumbai’s Saki Vihar, to pay nearly Rs 600 cr rent
items.summary: Rating agency Crisil has secured over 2.5 lakh sq ft of office space in Mumbai's Saki Vihar for 15 years, with total rentals nearing Rs 600 crore. This move signifies workspace consolidation, while the vacated Powai office has been leased by Brookfield Properties to CoWrks India for managed office services.

items.title: Adani’s Navi Mumbai airport to boost revenue with in-house retail push
items.summary: Navi Mumbai International Airport, operated by Adani Group, will prioritize in-house retail, dedicating 65-70% of its stores to group brands to boost non-aeronautical revenue. This strategy aims to create a demand-driven ecosystem, with non-aeronautical businesses projected to contribute 70% of total revenue by 2030. The airport, set to open in December, will integrate commercial services through the Adani One App.

items.title: Government eyes to increase pulses production by 40% by 2030-31 crop year
items.summary: India aims for self-sufficiency in pulses by 2030-31. A new six-year mission will boost production by 40 percent. The government plans to increase cultivation area and crop productivity. Focus will be on key pulses like tur, urad, and masur. Assured procurement will support farmers. High-yielding seeds will be promoted to meet domestic demand.

items.title: India’s chickpea imports from Australia may drop by over 50% next season
items.summary: New Delhi may not import over 500,000 tonnes against 1.4 million tonnes this season

items.title: IndiGo to increase flights to Manchester
items.summary: IndiGo is boosting its UK services. More flights will now fly to Manchester. The airline is increasing its Winter capacity. Delhi to Manchester flights will go from four to five weekly. Mumbai to Manchester flights will increase from three to four weekly. These services will use Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner planes. This expansion marks IndiGo's growing international reach.

items.title: House Price Index up 3.6% annually in Q1: RBI
items.summary: House prices across India saw a 3.6 percent rise year-on-year in the first quarter of the current fiscal. This growth is lower than the previous year's 7.6 percent. Nagpur, Chandigarh, Chennai, and Kochi recorded the highest increases quarter-on-quarter. The Reserve Bank of India released this data with a new base year of 2022-23, including eight new cities.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
